texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: On brand new Plesk 8.2.x installations or on servers that have been upgraded to Plesk 8.2.x, you might run into this error when you attempt to log into squirrelmail after it was installed via RPM:
texts.text: On brand new Plesk 8.2.x installations or on servers that have been upgraded to Plesk 8.2.x, you might run into this error when you attempt to log into squirrelmail after it was installed via RPM:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
Error opening /var/lib/squirrelmail/prefs/default_pref
Could not create initial preference file!
/var/lib/squirrelmail/prefs/ should be writable by user apache
Please contact your system administrator and report this error.
texts.text:
Error opening /var/lib/squirrelmail/prefs/default_pref
Could not create initial preference file!
/var/lib/squirrelmail/prefs/ should be writable by user apache
Please contact your system administrator and report this error.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: No matter what you do to the /var/lib/squirrelmail/prefs/default_pref file, even if you chmod 777 the file, you will still get the error. If you check the /etc/php.ini, you will normally find
texts.text: No matter what you do to the /var/lib/squirrelmail/prefs/default_pref file, even if you chmod 777 the file, you will still get the error. If you check the /etc/php.ini, you will normally find

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: to  off  and reload Apache. If you try to log into squirrelmail again, it should complete successfully. I've tested this on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4:
texts.text: to  off  and reload Apache. If you try to log into squirrelmail again, it should complete successfully. I've tested this on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4:
